verses.roman:
madyapa yavana-rājāra āge adhikāra
tāṅra bhaye pathe keha nāre calibāra

synonyms: madyapa—drunkard; yavana—Mohammedan; rājāra—of a king; āge—ahead; adhikāra—the government; tāṅra bhaye—being afraid of such a king; pathe—on the road; keha—anyone; nāre—not able; calibāra—to travel.
translation: He informed the Lord that the territory ahead was ruled by a Moslem governor, who was a drunkard. Out of fear for this king, no one could walk the road freely.
